title: Restore site images, update brand icon assets, and ensure deploy-ready static asset wiring

requirements.summary: Generate and wire new brand icon assets from download-2.webp for favicon and header/footer logo usage.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` references the new generated favicon (32x32) and apple-touch-icon (180x180) under `/assets/generated/`.
Header and footer in `frontend/src/App.tsx` use the new generated square brand icon under `/assets/generated/`.
All user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description: Add the newly generated square brand mark derived from `download-2.webp` (enhanced contrast/legibility) for use as the site logo in the React UI.
Add the newly generated 32x32 favicon derived from `download-2.webp` for browser tab icon usage.
Add the newly generated 180x180 Apple touch icon derived from `download-2.webp` for iOS home screen usage.
Ensure the favicon and apple-touch-icon link tags reference the new generated files under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and that paths remain consistent for production builds.
Ensure the header and footer logo `` uses `bmc-icon.dim_512x512.png` under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and remove/replace any older logo references if present.

requirements.summary: Fix broken/non-visible images by ensuring assets exist in the built output, use URL-safe paths, and gracefully handle missing optional images.
acceptanceCriteria: In the deployed site, the hero background image renders and the service-section galleries render without broken images.
Image URLs used by the app are URL-safe and load correctly in production hosting (e.g., avoid unencoded spaces in public asset paths).
If any optional images are missing at runtime, the UI degrades gracefully (no layout break), and missing images are not shown as broken thumbnails.

requirements.summary: Ensure frontend build is deploy-ready so the public link loads the latest SPA assets and displays the new favicon.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary public URL for the site loads the SPA successfully in both mobile and desktop browsers without “Canister ID Not Resolved”.
After rebuild/redeploy, the favicon/website icon displayed in the browser tab matches the newly uploaded image-derived icon.

file_operations.description: Harden deploy behavior by ensuring static asset references (favicons and the module script path) are correct for production hosting, and add a `<base>` configuration if needed so the SPA resolves asset URLs reliably after redeploy.
Verify the generated favicon file content matches the newly uploaded image-derived icon and is the one served after rebuild/redeploy (replace file contents if necessary).
